components.name: Customer Support Center
components.description: This includes services related to reaching support via phone, email, and chat.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Virgin Mobile (Three MVNO) in Ireland 272-15

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing SMS Delivery Delays to Virgin Mobile (Three MVNO) in Ireland. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SMS and MMS Delivery Delays To and From a Subset of Twilio Phone Numbers in Australia

incident_updates.body:
We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 and 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.

For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an ongoing undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.

For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an ongoing undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.

For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an ongoing undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.

For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an ongoing undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.

For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an ongoing undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.
For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.
We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an ongoing undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in SMS and MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However, the actual SMS and MMS are being delivered on time.

For the SMS and MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an on-going undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have confirmed that this incident is impacting SMS and MMS Delivery Report delays when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia rather than SMS and MMS message delivery when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, and we can confirm that SMS and MMS delivery is operating normally; delayed delivery reports may be more noticeable during peak traffic in Australia between 14:0020:00 PST. Our investigation indicates the primary contributor is an ongoing undersea cable fault causing increased latency, and our engineers are working closely with our carrier partner to mitigate the impact and restore normal delivery report timing. We will provide another update within 24 hours, or sooner if more information becomes available.

We have confirmed that this incident is impacting SMS and MMS Delivery Report delays when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia rather than SMS and MMS message delivery when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, and we can confirm that SMS and MMS delivery is operating normally; delayed delivery reports may be more noticeable during peak traffic in Australia between 14:0020:00 PST. Our investigation indicates the primary contributor is an ongoing undersea cable fault causing increased latency, and our engineers are working closely with our carrier partner to mitigate the impact and restore normal delivery report timing. We will provide another update within 24 hours, or sooner if more information becomes available.

We have confirmed that this incident is impacting MMS Delivery Report delays when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia rather than MMS message delivery when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, and we can confirm that MMS delivery is operating normally; delayed delivery reports may be more noticeable during peak traffic in Australia between 14:0020:00 PST. Our investigation indicates the primary contributor is an ongoing undersea cable fault causing increased latency, and our engineers are working closely with our carrier partner to mitigate the impact and restore normal delivery report timing. We will provide another update within 24 hours, or sooner if more information becomes available.

We have confirmed that this incident is impacting MMS Delivery Report delays when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia rather than MMS message delivery when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, and we can confirm that MMS delivery is operating normally; delayed delivery reports may be more noticeable during peak traffic in Australia between 14:0020:00 PST. Our investigation indicates the primary contributor is an ongoing undersea cable fault causing increased latency, and our engineers are working closely with our carrier partner to mitigate the impact and restore normal delivery report timing. We will provide another update within 24 hours, or sooner if more information becomes available.

We continue to observe latency in MMS delivery when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia specially during the Australia peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. We have also identified MMS delivery failures to and from the impacted subset of Twilio Numbers in Australia. We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an on-going undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. For the MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an on-going undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Private offering and Porting Request forms are currently unavailable in Console

incident_updates.body: While we have identified the issue, our engineering team is continuing to work on a fix for the issues affecting Private Offering and International Porting fulfillment at Twilio. While customers are still able to submit requests, confirmation emails are being sent and fulfillment may be delayed. Our team is working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 16 hours or sooner if additional information becomes available.

We are actively investigating ongoing issues affecting Private Offering and International Porting fulfillment at Twilio. While customers are still able to submit requests, confirmation emails may not be sent and fulfillment may be delayed. Our team is working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 8 hours or sooner if additional information becomes available.

We are actively investigating ongoing issues affecting Private Offering and International Porting fulfillment at Twilio. While customers are still able to submit requests, confirmation emails may not be sent and fulfillment may be delayed. Our team is working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner if additional information becomes available.

We are actively investigating ongoing issues affecting Private Offering and International Porting fulfillment at Twilio. While customers are still able to submit requests, confirmation emails may not be sent and fulfillment may be delayed. Our team is working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner if additional information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue where the Private Offering form and Porting Request form in Console are currently unavailable. Our team is working on getting it restored. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

scheduled_maintenances.name: United Arab Emirates SMS Carrier Maintenance - Etisalat

incident_updates.body: The Etisalat network in the United Arab Emirates is conducting a planned maintenance from 27 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 27 January 2026 at 18:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to Etisalat United Arab Emirates handsets.

scheduled_maintenances.name: United States and Canada Twilio SMS and MMS Maintenance

incident_updates.body: Twilio is conducting a planned maintenance from 28 January 2026 at 20:00 PST until 29 January 2026 at 00:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays or failures delivering SMS and MMS to and from United States and Canada handsets via subset of long codes, short codes and toll free numbers.

scheduled_maintenances.name: United Kingdom Account Security Carrier Partner Maintenance - Vodafone

incident_updates.body:
Our carrier partner Vodafone United Kingdom is conducting a planned maintenance from 29 January 2026 at 14:20 PST until 29 January 2026 at 20:40 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent API request failures for Vodafone United Kingdom customers.

Impacted Products: Lookup Identity Match, Legacy Identity MatchAndAttributes

scheduled_maintenances.name: Twilio Flex insights database upgrade - Maintenance

incident_updates.body:
Were conducting a planned maintenance in US1 between 8:30 PM and 10:30 PM Pacific Time on 01/29/2026. During the maintenance window, customers may experience the below issue:
-Flex Realtime stats APIs may return 5xx errors for up to 5 minutes.
-Flex Realtime stats APIs might return bloated data `completed` metrics due to database maintenance.

scheduled_maintenances.name: United Kingdom Account Security Carrier Partner Maintenance - Three

incident_updates.body:
Our carrier partner Three United Kingdom is conducting a planned maintenance from 29 January 2026 at 21:00 PST until 29 January 2026 at 22:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent API request failures for Three United Kingdom customers.

Impacted Products: Lookup SIM Swap, Lookup Identity Match, Legacy Identity MatchAndAttributes

scheduled_maintenances.name: United Kingdom Account Security Carrier Partner Maintenance - Three

Twilio will conduct a planned maintenance from 28 February 2026 at 22:00 PST until 01 March 2026 at 05:30 PST on the Twilio Network. During the maintenance window there could be intermittent message delivery failures and delivery delays to and from the US connecting through Twilios US2/San Jose edge location.

incident_updates.body: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

The Tele2 network in Russia is conducting a series of planned maintenances from 12 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 28 January 2026 at 16:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to Tele2 Russia handsets.

Note, the maintenance will be carried out on each of the following dates and times:

12 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 12 January 2026 at 16:00 PST
14 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 14 January 2026 at 16:00 PST
19 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 19 January 2026 at 16:00 PST
21 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 21 January 2026 at 16:00 PST
26 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 26 January 2026 at 16:00 PST
28 January 2026 at 12:00 PST until 28 January 2026 at 16:00 PST
